clinical_study.official_title: Infrared Thermographic Imaging for Early Assessment of Epidural Block Success in Obstetric Anesthesia

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to describe infrared thermographic imaging as a tool for the assessment of epidural block in obstetrics patients

detailed_description.textblock: Patients will recive standard anesthesia care for epidural placement and additionally, thermographic imaging will be obtained at baseline and up to 30 min after the epidural blockade is performed.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in temperature in the lower extremities
primary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, 5 min before the epidural blockade, during and up to 30 minutes after performing the epidural blockade
primary_outcome.description: thermographic images of the lower extremities will be obtained and analyzed for thermography patterns.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 30 min after performing the epidural block
secondary_outcome.description: adequate sensory level, pain control, motor blockade as evaluated by care provider

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 min after performing the epidural block
secondary_outcome.description: Failure of the epidural block to adequately control pain, unilateral blockade, optimal sensory level, inadequate motor blockade

secondary_outcome.measure: Requirement for Epidural catheter manipulation or replacement
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 min after performing the epidural block

other_outcome.time_frame: participants will be followed for the duration of anesthesia and after the procedure, an expected average of 12 hours

arm_group.description: Pt receiving standard Epidural block care for vaginal delivery

intervention.description: Using infrared-recording camera will obtain thermographic images of the lower extremities before and after the epidural blockade

study_pop.textblock: Parturients in active labor, older than18 year of age, requesting epidural anesthesia for normal vaginal delivery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Parturients in active labor requesting epidural anesthesia for normal vaginal delivery
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with lower extremity skin disorders like active infections like cellulitis, ,dermatitis, psoriasis or connective tissue disorders like scleroderma or Raynaud's phenomenon
- Patients with diagnosed peripheral vascular disease ,venous stasis , deep venous thrombosis.
- Patients with Severe preeclampsia with significant lower extremity edema
- Patient on vasoactive agents like vasodilators, calcium channels blockers.
